Historian Tal Bruttmann's sharp eye on the Holocaust
Subhead: In his latest book, the French historian continues his investigation into the photographs taken by the SS in 1944 at Auschwitz – archives that had never been used before – and tirelessly challenges misconceptions about the Holocaust.

Democratic leaders in Congress demand a meeting with Trump as a government shutdown looms
Subhead: While Democrats are pushing to preserve healthcare programs before the September 30 funding deadline, they maintain that Republicans are refusing to enter talks per Trump's insistence. On Friday, the US president said that there could be 'a closed country for a period of time.'

Title: Venezuela offers military training to civilians amid Trump's threats of 'incalculable' consequences
Subhead: The US President said on Saturday that Venezuela must accept 'all of the prisoners and people from mental institutions' who were 'forced' into the United States. In response to rising tensions between the two countries, Venezuela organized a day of military training for civilians.

Title: Grenoble, Strasbourg and Rennes top France's ranking of bike-friendly cities
Subhead: After surveying thousands of riders, cycling advocates on Thursday released their ranking of France's most bike-friendly cities, aiming to shape debate ahead of the 2026 municipal elections.

Title: Japan faces a rising wave of xenophobia
Subhead: Long resistant to immigration, Japan has witnessed its foreign-born population increase rapidly. This trend has contributed to a sense of insecurity, which has spread on social media and been fueled by politicians who seize on any incident to stoke fear and rejection of foreigners.

The 'One Piece' flag finds its place in protests across France
Subhead: The pirate flag from the crew of the famous manga appeared on banners and placards during protests in France on September 18, not only due to its popularity but also because of its political undertones.

Title: French protestors caught between anger and disillusionment
Subhead: Eight days after the 'Block Everything' protest movement on September 10, the union coalition called for mobilization against 'austerity' on Thursday, September 18. More than 250 gatherings took place across France, demanding a change in political direction and greater tax justice.

Title: Eleven places in France to visit during 2025 European Heritage Days
Subhead: Each fall, the event opens doors to historic sites that are usually closed to the public. Le Monde picks 11 of the most compelling hidden gems in France.
